content:
Glad to see we have a 'signup with Apple' option, but the button looks very different from the other ones. Was this a conscious decision?

Edit: Found some relevant discussion

Screenshot_2.png
@Vinit Singh yes, it's required by Apple's policies.
It's possible that we should think about changing our our buttons to look more similar to the Apple one; right now it gives the Apple button undue emphasis.
We haven't turned this on anywhere outside the development environment yet.

I actually wonder, do we actually need the server to show this awfully looking button? Could we use our normal style for it, and delegate it to the mobile app to show the style demanded by Apple? As I'd expect their policies to only care about that. Perhaps there already was some discussion that I may have missed on one of the many PRs/threads about Apple auth :thinking:
I'm not sure if it is obligatory. But they wanted us to follow these guidelines when creating a custom button. They had rules on what the ratio of text to button should be, and some other things.
Based on the Creating a Custom Sign in with Apple Button section, it does look like we should be able to just use our standard left-aligned approach.
@Dinesh Ch want to look at changing that to work normally?
Okay, will work on it now. :slight_smile:

This is how they look now. Is the order of buttons fine?
apple-signup.png apple-login.png
(Them giving the rules/guidelines in that section made it seem like it's a compulsion to either follow those or use the button they provide)
That looks better! We may need to fix the size on the GitLab logo; that looks off.
But certainly the Apple part is an improvement.

I got the GitLab logo from https://about.gitlab.com/press/press-kit/
Should I look for some other image with different dimensions or should we make some CSS changes?
Maybe CSS changes? It just looks like it's expecting to have its entire padding in the logo image you have in a way that looks off.

gitlab.png
Does this look good?
(Tried some CSS, wasn't confident to try CSS earlier :sweat_smile: )
